name: Locavorian
tag_list: local, local-foods, local-products, locally-made, locally-made-products, sustainability, locavore, locavores, responsible-consumption, local-movement, locavorism
overview:
Locavorian (www.locavorian.com) is a useful and engaging crowd source platform and social network that helps users everywhere in the world geolocate and purchase locally made products, as well as to share information about them. Locavorian enables local consumers, producers, and retailers to connect with each other and together build more sustainable communities. Locavorian’s motto is, ‘Support your local economy, your planet, your neighbors.’

With a strong emphasis on responsible consumption, Locavorian not only encourages users to share knowledge about WHERE things are made but also about HOW. Locavorian Excellence is a unique stamp that awards organizations that do well by doing good (meaning they are respectful to the environment, and/or give back to society through social and/or philanthropic programs).

Locavorian is built in the Yii framework and uses Google Maps API.

Locavorian is owned by Locavorian Platform, Inc., a startup company based in California founded in June 2012 by Internet entrepreneurs Johnny Martel and Marta Mariné (originators of the idea), and Francisco Hurtado (Chief Technical Officer).
